page.title: 01 GENERAL GAZETEER
page.content: GENERAL GAZETEER The area is situated on the S.edge of the{Chilterns,}fairly sparsely populated but within easy reach of H. Wycombe (8km) & Oxford (32km). The M40 cuts across the S.W. Population is mainly concentrated around the A40, formerly the main London_Oxford Rd. There's 1 small town{Stokenchurch,}& several villages _Beacons Bottom ,Radnage & Bledlow Ridge being the main ones. The country side, mainly farm land, is undulating, the highest Pt. being 225m. There is a chalk escarpment in the N.E.at Bledlow Ridge Several areas of deciduous woodland crown the hills in the form of{beech} hangers.Many footpaths cross the area Of interest is a Norman_ towered church at Radnage & Bottom Wood,an ancient woodland.Traces of Bronze Age & Roman Settlements have been found.
